lead_paragraph: The former Oklahoma quarterback Rhett Bomar was ruled ineligible yesterday to play for Sam Houston State this season but will return in 2007 with two years of eligibility remaining. Bomar and offensive lineman J. D. Quinn were kicked off the Sooners’ squad in August for accepting payment for more work than they performed at a car dealership, a violation of N.C.A.A. rules. Bomar transferred to Sam Houston and Quinn to Montana, both Division I-AA schools. Quinn also was ruled ineligible by the N.C.A.A. but will be allowed to play next season, according to Montana officials.
